Fields.DialogueText: Morganas spotted due east, Cap'n!
Action stations!
@BATTLE
Captain!
What?
Come look at this. I think you'll really fancy it.
Look, I'm busy here. We just wrapped up a fight and I have paperwork to fill out.
It'll just take a second, I promise!

Fields.MenuText: What exactly are you doing?
You seem awfully... fidgety today.
This really can't wait?

Fields.DialogueText: I just want to show you this book I'm reading. Just a minute?
Do I? Must just be the coffee.
I'd prefer it didn't.
This is really important, Captain.
Got it. We'll chat later, Edinburgh.
Bet on it, Captain.
Edinburgh?
Not going to overreact. Nope. Nae danger.
Keep it together, Edinburgh. You're stronger than any curse.
Captain, Captain! Had the latest from the book club?

Fields.MenuText: Well, not anymore, whatever it is.
Should I be concerned?
The real surprise will be you keeping the secret.

Fields.DialogueText: If you don't expect nice things now and again, I've clearly fallen down on the job!
Have I ever given you cause?
I haven't even told Belfast, Captain! And I tell her everything.
You can do just about anything you decide to do.
Then this ought to blow you away!
Does this have anything to do with the leather you requisitioned?
Got it in one! I should show you what I'm working on once the battle's done.
"That too?"
I still need to get around to joining.
Ah, pure barry. That means this will be a surprise.
Why not tell me now?
*ALARM*
That too.
Well, it's best if I show you in person. Nearby.
@BATTLE
Edinburgh...
Perhaps with a few candles lit and-
*BOOM*
Awright, you weapons! You're chibbing my patience right down to the bone!
Look, I don't know what's gotten into you, but you need to stop.
I'm not doing anything wrong, am I?
For starters, you keep trying to get the Captain to stop working.
Problems, sailor?
Captain.
What's going on?
I was trying to talk some sense into Edinburgh here.
Nothing's wrong. So let's end this conversation. Now.
Edinburgh is always trying to lure you away from your post, Captain. It's becoming a distraction.

Fields.MenuText: I can handle myself.
Edinburgh, take it easy and let's work this out.
It's not a problem. You're dismissed.

Fields.DialogueText: See? The Captain can handle multiple things at once. Now, bolt!
See, sailor? It's between us two.
Yes, Captain.
@BATTLE
What the heck is all this about, Edinburgh?
You, obviously! I've been hemming at you near every free moment I've got.
*ALARM*
Well, we're in fine shape, so I appreciate your diligence. But I haven't had time for much else than work lately.
Don't worry, Edinburgh. As soon as I get some breathing room, I'm all yours.
One empty ocean, coming up!
Edinburgh, we have to talk about your collection.
You want to borrow some books? I've some muckle tomes that'll occupy you for the rest of the tour.
It's not that.
The Italian lass has sent me some more books, too! Perhaps we can make an evening of it.
Edinburgh...
I thought I'd start with an adventure. Perhaps a bit of Orlando Furioso...

Fields.MenuText: Edinburgh, let me speak.
If they're going to be in my room, keep the place tidy.
How do you have time to read all these?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, sorry! I forgot to apologise about how messy this room is! I'll clean it up, Captain!
Don't worry, Captain! I've a method to all this. Ask me what's in any of the stacks.
Well, I obviously haven't gotten through them all. But a bit here and a bit there gets me a long way.
@BATTLE
Keep it tidy in here, or I'll run out of room and have nowhere to sleep!
Very funny. I'll help you tidy up Toad Hall. First, let's get rid of the weasels.
Don't worry, Captain, I'm a fast reader. Worst case scenario... well, those leather book covers I make are awfully soft.
I'm going to have to insist. Kenneth Grahame doesn't write the best pillows.
*ALARM*
Some of my best kips have been on an open copy of The Wind in the Willows!
Captain! We have an emergency!
Edinburgh, what's going on?
My hands! Look!
You have two of them.
My gloves! They're gone!

Fields.MenuText: I don't think that's really an emergency.
I'm sure you left them lying around somewhere.
Need help finding them?

Fields.DialogueText: It is, Captain! I can't afford an ounce of stiffness in battle!
I know where every book is aboard me, Captain! I don't lose things!
I'll tear the ship apart without it, Captain!
Feel my hands! It's pure Baltic in here!
They don't seem too bad.
No, no, they're freezing!
See?
You can let go now, Edinburgh.
Right! Right, of course. My apologies.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Damn. As if we didn't have enough problems. Now the Morganas-
Gah! Captain...
We'll get through it. You're stronger than a little cold. Or a little curse.
You're right, Captain. But once we're through here, I'm wrapping my hands around a big mug of the blackest tea I can find.
A moment, Captain?
Sure. What's the issue?
It's about the book club.
You wanted to join?
I wanted to raise concerns. Edinburgh has been getting more and more books for her collection lately.
Which she keeps well-organized and clean in my quarters.
We should all be so lucky. Some corridors and closets are getting cramped. I don't know how she reads all these, but they're going to seriously get in our way before long.

Fields.MenuText: She keeps her books organized... in her own way.
That's news to me. I'm going to have to give her a dressing down.
That sauna she keeps banging on about would take up even more space.

Fields.DialogueText: That's good for her, Captain, but I nearly tripped over one of them. I'm the third officer Peter Pan's attacked this week.
I'm sure she'd appreciate it.
With respect, she did want to use your quarters specifically for that.
Pardon?
Oh, nothing, Captain.
She's a good Belle, but you never know what you're going to get from her.
Hasn't she been after you about a gift of some kind?
Oh, damn, you're right. I'll just let her keep it until the ship's a little tidier.
That'll work?
*ALARM*
Awright, beasties, I dinnae ken how you ken, but you've interrupted my bookbinding for the last- ghk! Captain!
Good hustle. I'll meet you on the bridge.
Huge incentive. She's terrible at keeping secrets.
See?
@BATTLE
I've a feeling you didn't call me in here just to talk books.
Well, yes and no. The crew have raised concerns about your methods.
I know where they all are, Captain. All they need do is ask.
They're intimately familiar. Enough tripping will do that.
Oh, jings, I thought I'd sorted it.

Fields.MenuText: In my quarters, yes. For which I thank you.
Will you?
You thought you'd distracted me.

Fields.DialogueText: Anything for you, Captain. I should have done the same for the crew.
Of course, Captain. Nae danger.
You don't mean that, Captain. I just... oh, it's embarrassing.
Just do something about the books, won't you?
If we could only get the rest of the crew in on the book club...
If you're willing to bring it up to them all during assembly, that's your business.
And those nasty weapons coming over the horizon are here for us, too. Let's give them a go!
@BATTLE
I just might. A bit of top-to-bottom reorganizing might get me closer to my gloves, too.
See? Solve one problem with another. I know you'll do well at it, too.
I've noticed. I liked the thistles you left in a vase on my desk.
I try to go the extra mile, Captain!
Oh! I'm glad, Captain. Thought you might appreciate a bit of colour.
Was there anything else you wanted to tell me?
*ALARM*
... Aye.
Well, just know that I'm here when you want to discuss it.
Another day, another covey of hags to fight.
@BATTLE
Another battle is over! Time for drinks!
Any drink in particular, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Something light. I'll pass on your favorite cocktail.
Maybe some coffee. It's going to be a long night of paperwork.
Water. I'm thirsty.

Fields.DialogueText: Looks like I'll just have to win a bigger battle next time!
Oh, that can wait! I'll help you out with it if it's got you that scunnered.
Ice cold!
Those spooky lasses won't forget that one for a while. You've got at least a little time to celebrate!
I have to have a cool head in times like these. How do you keep cool?
Look, it's a lot of pressure being a fast warship like me. Relaxation is important, you know.
I'm trying. It's full of books.
Once things cool down, I want to show you some of the book covers I made! Especially that one I've been jabbing at you. Interested?
Of course! I've kept you waiting long enough.
I might not understand your aversion to the M-word, but I'm starting to have fun with it.
The perk of reading widely. There are so many other words!
It's a bigger bastard of a task to police the whole crew's lingo. No sense moaning about it all the time. You've got to leave space for yourself.
Even with a curse breathing down our necks.
I don't mind sharing space with you.
Come on, Edinburgh! You haven't had your cocktail yet!
Dinnae flap, sailor, you know I wouldn't miss it!
Time's ticking!
Hibernian are some of the hardest workers in the league! You're spewing pure keech!
I'm calling it like I see it! If I were superstitious, I'd say that Ibrox disaster was the Devil's price for your win back in '02!
You heartless dobber! Take that back!
Make me!
You Midlothians are all the same! I'll find a great solid pile of steel beams and see how you like it, you-
Whoa! What's going on here?
This numpty is what's going on!
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: I don't care who started it. We're not letting the Morganas end it.
Don't antagonize the Belle, sailor. You know better.

Fields.DialogueText: I've a thing or two for them to end...
Not bloody likely.
@BATTLE
... Football rivalry, Captain. What can I say?
That's not the whole story and you-

Fields.MenuText: You're the ship, he's the sailor. You should set a better example.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll make an example of him, all right.
A drought, for starters.
Tell me where to shoot, Captain. I don't want to make any rash decisions.
Anywhere but the football pitch.
I know enough to win a bet or two around football season.
Oary gadge. I ought to batter him pure skyrocket.
What happened?
Didn't you hear him, Captain? Football rivalry.
There's more to it than that.
Aye. I'm a Hibernian girl through and through. He's diehard Heart of Midlothian. Nothing inherently wrong with that.

Fields.MenuText: Haven't a clue.
A stand collapsed at a soccer match, right?
Real Madrid was founded?

Fields.DialogueText: You'd be forgiven. It seems so small compared to what's going on now.
It delayed that year's Scottish Cup final. More importantly, a lot of people were hurt and worse.
You're not wrong, Captain, but do be serious.
Ibrox Park. April. That stand collapse was the worst thing it ever saw. Nobody who got caught up in it deserved any of it.
And our sailor had the pure audacity to suggest that... that it was because of some deal with the Devil that gave Hibernian the win that year.
That's despicable.
*ALARM*
And besides, his team hasn't won in decades either! None of the Edinburgh teams have! It's so... ugh!
@BATTLE
But he was talking absolute Turkish Delight about the Hibs' last Cup win. 1902. Do you recall what else happened in 1902?
Eight different ways, Captain, besides the obvious. Hibs and Hearts ought to stick together. We're both Edinburgh.
I'll talk to him. Let's play a little defense.
Mail's here. That Italian lassie wrote me back.
Another thank you letter?
She's taking to Stevenson like nobody I've ever seen.
She really seems grateful!
I'm surprised that she'd... well, would you look at that? She sent me something!
A wooden heart? Why a heart?
I was half expecting a skull from this one, if we're being honest. But isn't it just the most precious wee thing you saw?

Fields.MenuText: Edinburgh, thank you.
I think you should keep it.
I don't know what to say.

Fields.DialogueText: You're welcome, Captain. I've accumulated so much treasure... you should have a piece.
I insist, Captain! You need it! Think of it as a good luck charm.
You don't have to say anything, Captain! That it's in your possession is enough for me.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I want you to have it.
If there were ever a time to get this, it's now.
Coincidence or no, I hope it inspires you! A blessing or a curse is what you make of it.
And speaking of gifts, I still need to...
Still need to what?
Um... Feed Trent his own heart! That's it. A bit of irony and encouragement from across the sea, this was.
You keep your temper better than you keep a secret.
Sorry, Captain! Afraid I don't know what you mean.
You wanted to see us, Captain?
Yes, but we're headed into a fight. Report after the battle.
@BATTLE
I brought you two in here to settle this.
Good. I demand an apology!
You might get one next time Hibernian wins, you-
Stop. Just stop. Both your teams are from Edinburgh. Both haven't won a Cup since Edward VII was king. Trying to pin a disaster on hers is just low.
And?
And you need to apologize. Now.
You heard the Captain!

Fields.MenuText: You're not only going to apologize, but you'll be on cleaning duty from here on out.
Let me handle this, Edinburgh. You nearly came to blows over this.
You too. We can't have a Belle fighting her crew.

Fields.DialogueText: Fine. I'm sorry, Edinburgh. I was out of line.
No. I started this. I'm... I'm sorry, Edinburgh.
I was trying to get a rise out of you. I shouldn't have. I'm sorry.
I'm sorry, too. I should have kept it on the field.
I don't see why anyone else needs to get involved.
You don't need to. Let's take care of this first.
At least we can agree on one thing. I'm glad neither of us are St. Bernard's supporters. They haven't won a Cup since '95.
Ha! You're all right.
Everything okay?
I'm working on it, Captain. I think it was the deal-with-the-Devil thing that really drove me radge. The crew know how I am about curses.
Well, it was in awful taste. You forgave him quicker than I would have.
We should go to a match sometime, Captain. You'll hear ten times worse.
Let's put it behind us. Wasn't there a book you wanted to show me?
Ah! Right, then, just follow me...
You're in your quarters early.
Well, we dealt with the Morg- I mean, we dealt with the dolton drookit wenches pretty quickly.
I'm fine, Edinburgh. What's that in your arms?
N-nothing...
If it's nothing, then why are you blushing?
It's just warm in here...
Not without your gloves, it's not.
Awright, fine! I finished that book I showed you the other day.

Fields.MenuText: The romance novel?
There's nothing to be embarrassed about.
I didn't know you liked this stuff.

Fields.DialogueText: Y-yes! That French cruiser thought I might like it, and I'd finished it...
Ha! No, there's not. Just a wee test, Captain.
Just trying something new, Captain! I'm not all pirates and philosophy, you know.
Action stations, people! Let's show these... Edinburgh?
Dolton drookit wenches!
... Right. Let's show those things we mean business.
@BATTLE
You didn't skelp yourself during battle, did you?
It's just like with the heart, right? Something nice someone in the club sent you that you thought I might like.
And I figured I'd pretty it up a tad. Even if you don't read it, well, it'll look nice in your quarters.
I can't even tell this is a new cover. You did a really good job with this one. And the leather's so soft.
Aye, well... if you're busy, I think I left a... torpedo in my rudder. So... see you round the morn's morn, then?
Hmm. She's usually so direct...
How's the book, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: I really haven't had time to read, but your book's at the top of my list.
Slow. But I'm finding time between the paperwork.
Were you expecting me to read? I thought I might run a hand across the cover now and again.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, keep that list going! I get more in every week.
Got to claw it back where you can. Out-beast the beasties!
Jings, I ought to have made you some gloves.
I wish I had more time, but it's dangerous out here.
Doesn't stop the crew from having a laugh now and again.
They don't have Command constantly asking after them.
Command are well invested in my doings. I still throw a few back with the crew. Come on, we'll read together.
Together?
Our own wee book club. Just you and me. Maybe on a clear evening with a bottle of-
*ALARM*
Damnation and hellfire!
@BATTLE
That sounds a little spicy for an evening in with a book.
So that's an aye, then?
Aye!
Looking ahead, are we?
Why romance?
W-well, I'm not used to it. It was the mademoiselle's idea.
She's been choosing a fair few romances lately. If I were the gossiping type I'd think she was graftin' someone.

Fields.MenuText: Imagine that. A Belle with a crush.
We don't have to do this if it's embarrassing.
Romance is a war-proof genre.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh... pure zany, isn't it? Imagine a warship blushing like a lass on the schoolyard...
Embarrassed? Don't be mental! I'm just... um...
We get enough brawling and shooting at work. All the more reason to relax with something cosy that makes you blush.
@BATTLE
You're blushing right now.
Actually, I had a question about the book.
Oh, you know I can't keep a secret. Least of all from myself. But you'll like this book. And not just because it's well comfy to hold.
Aye?
Just... running my boilers hot! Overcompensating for the missing gloves.
Might I borrow a list of the crew in your book club? I bet they're the ones closest to your possessions.
Belter idea, Captain! I'll get it to you after this witch burning.
*ALARM*
I just don't know what she's trying to prove.
It's getting a bit ridiculous.
You don't think this is about-
What are you two talking about?
Captain!
Hello, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: Causing trouble?
You two should be at your posts.
We don't have time to talk.

Fields.DialogueText: Not at all, Captain!
We were on our way, Captain!
But we really should.
We still need to discuss Edinburgh.
She's still acting strange?
She's distracting the crew.
Fixated, eh? I think I know how we can fix this situation.
Fix these Morganas first, Officer. That's an order.
Aye-aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Ordinarily I'd call that the crew's problem. But I understand how intense a Belle can be when she gets fixated on something.
Captain, I think I have a plan.
Edinburgh again? We spend lots of time together. I can handle her.
That's fine, but we can't. If it's not near-brawls over football, it's a whole library's worth of obstacles. Whatever she wants, I think you're distracting her by not addressing it.
How is that my problem?
It isn't, but I know how you can be part of the solution. She's after something she doesn't want to come clean with. We just have to give it to her.
She has a book club.
I'm talking about a situation that won't be permanent. A Turkish situation, if you catch my drift.

Fields.MenuText: No. No, no, no. We're not putting a Turkish bathhouse in this ship.
I can't believe you're suggesting this. The cost alone...
Is there really no other way?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course it won't be an actual bathhouse! We'll improvise.
Is probably going to come in under budget. We're a resourceful bunch.
None that's nearly as fun. A couple mechanics and I were passing the idea around at lunch. We'll get back to you with details.
@BATTLE
Why can't we just find her her gloves?
Oh, those? I had one of the ensigns swipe them for a size reference. We were all throwing in for a new pair.
And you wanted it to be a surprise.
*ALARM*
How'd you guess?
Not guessing. Processing.
So what's my job in all this?
While we set everything up, you have to keep her away from the crew's quarters.
At least we're not sacrificing mine.
Now, during the next resupply, we'll get some makeshift tools for the quarters and make-
A bootleg Turkish bathhouse. I can't believe I just said that.
Yes. Stick to the plan...
Haw there, officers!
... And that's the situation. I'll be leaving now, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Edinburgh, let's get to the bridge.
And here I thought she'd want to say hello.
You missed nothing. Boring conversation, really.

Fields.DialogueText: Good instinct, Captain. Best to call canny on dreadful waters.
Well, we all get busy. Especially in waters like these. Pure dreadful, I'd say.
That's what I love about you. Always screening the dreadful bits.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Of course not. She keeps all her things there.
You don't say.
Speaking of things dreadful...
We've come this far. We can get a little farther.
The crew seem to be a lot busier lately.
Of course. We're increasing our efforts against the enemy.
But a fair few of them seem to be at some kind of maintenance. I don't think I took hits that would require... I mean, I would've known...
Well, we want to keep you in tip-top shape!
That's sweet of you, Captain! But I think something might be up. It's not the enemy, is it?

Fields.MenuText: We're all safe, Edinburgh. They can't touch us.
Well, they're not cursing us. We're just stepping up our vigilance.
Nope. And certainly not any kind of surprise, either.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose it might just be the knackeredness speaking.
Absolute reekbeek, those slags. But we can take them!
Aye, certainly not. I know what a great one you are for keeping surprises surprises.
Now, you wanted to talk about your recent book? Didn't one of the American Belles recommend it?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
The Great something-or-other. It's about a pack of rich gadges in New York.
Not ringing a bell. Is it new?
It's been around, but it didn't catch on until the Belles noticed it, and the humans noticed the Belles noticing. I'll lend it to you sometime. You'll blow through it in an afternoon.
I'll take you up on that. Let's make sure we don't get blown through.
Captain! My hands!
This again?
It's so cold! I can't believe we haven't found my gloves.
Neither can I. I'm sure someone knows where they are.
And I'm sure my hands are chankin' all to icebergs!
What!?
You know what I mean! I just need to warm up a tad. Sorry if mine are pure chilled.

Fields.MenuText: I'll help. Here.
Edinburgh, they're really not that cold.

Fields.DialogueText: Brilliant! Ooh, you do run tropical, don't you?
Says the person without any boilers! It's a matter of perspective.
Hmm. Maybe you're on to something.
Can I have yours?

Fields.MenuText: For a minute there I thought you were going to steal my hands.

Fields.DialogueText: You've got me mixed up with Nubian. It's she takes all the trophies.
Told you so. I've been near to starting my own campfire, the way I've been rubbing my hands together.
*ALARM*
... But this is nice.
You'd better let go.
No.
Edinburgh. One of us can translocate aboard you, and it's not me.
Awright, awright. But the minute I figure out how to bring you with when I teleport, you'll be the first to know.
@BATTLE
Another great victory!
I agree!
Let's head down to the crew's quarters and celebrate. Today's special!
Why?
Because they've been working hard lately! And they deserve a proper party!
We can't go to the crew's quarters.
Why?

Fields.MenuText: Because they are probably resting.
They're having a celebration of their own.
Th-they, um... they're definitely not working on anything secret.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't underestimate the power of a second wind, Captain!
Without the two of us? Well, I suppose they're allowed.
Nor would I be, Captain! I've got to unwind before one of those.
Then just the two of us celebrate together?
Didn't we have a book we wanted to read? With candles and wine?
Enemies coming over the horizon, starboard beam. Stations, Edinburgh!
@BATTLE
I did say that, didn't I? And without checking whether we had candles...
It's the thought that counts. We'll keep the lights on.
Captain, can we chat in your quarters?
*ALARM*
Sure, but it will have to wait. Come back here after.
@BATTLE
I know I've been acting a bit outlandish lately.
What do you mean?
I've been trying to show off for the crew and you - and at first I didn't know why.
Why would you need to show off? You're... well, you're you.
Then there was this whole hand-holding thing, but I knew where my gloves were...

Fields.MenuText: Really? You might want to check again.
On the gloves or on your books?
I guess that makes things simpler.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh. Don't mind if I do.
Bit of both. You know, speaking of open books...
I like it better that way.
So... you can tell, right? How I feel?
I have a pretty good idea.
Good. Because I'm still figuring out just what it means. But... I feel like it's part of a bigger puzzle, and you've got at least a bit of the rest.
Wait. You knew where your gloves were?
Well, not right away. I only overheard the other day when I interrupted you.
Edinburgh, I-
Nae danger, Captain. I knew the crew were only trying to keep things incognito.
Besides, your hands are almost as soft as the leather.
A fresh perspective always helps.
A bit like a book the girls pass around. Some of us can write ten pages on Steinbeck. Some of us just enjoy the ride.
Well, if you're asking me to read with you, the answer's yes. I'd like to see where the story goes.
Somewhere pure braw, I reckon.
How is it coming, Captain?
Good. Status of Edinburgh's surprise?
Just about done!
Excellent. I think overhearing about the gloves relaxed her a good deal.
Among other things.
Classified.
Yes, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: You sure you couldn't get used to this?
The sacrifice of your quarters will be remembered.

Fields.DialogueText: Eventually the crew will want their quarters back. No matter how much they appreciate the steam.
It's the least we can do for a Belle that knows how to party. Besides, I like playing matchmaker.
Like they were never crooked!
Time to put our plans to the test.
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: Now, we are setting these quarters straight again after, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry, Captain. Nobody's going to let us blow up before we get to enjoy this.
@BATTLE
Not such a fan of this book, then?
I get what Fitzgerald's going for. All the success in the world couldn't get Gatsby what he really wanted.
And most of those around him had lost sight of it long ago.
It's just... I know all this. I'm a simple person. I've never been one to care what other people thought about me.
Anything.

Fields.MenuText: In fairness, I would.
I can make it an order.
I guess you'll have to let the secret stay secret.

Fields.DialogueText: I know. But I'll humour you.
And take all the fun out of it? On second thought... no. Bad Edinburgh. Focus.
Impossible. I'll be right back.
The benefits of translocation. Let's go see...
Oh! It's perfect! Captain! It's so warm and steamy... you had the crew build it for me?
Their idea. Go on, relax! The whole section's yours while we've got it.
Thank you, Captain! Thank you so much!
Three... two... one...
As long as we don't have enemy contact, stay in there as long as you like!
Damn it! Fine, then. I can take a jinx or two!
@BATTLE
Come on. We can be honest with each other.
I enjoy bits and pieces. His dialogue's great.
I do.
An excellent trait in a captain. You should care about what the ship thinks.
I'd appreciate that. Oh, speaking of surprises... do me a favor?
Well, they can't all be belters. Next time, I'll find one that might surprise you a little more.
*ALARM*
Go to the crew's quarters, toward the stern end. Tell me what you see.
Mm. You wouldn't rather I stay on this pile of soft, leatherbound books with you and this lovely tea?
The bathhouse... Oh, I'm at a loss for words just thinking about it all.
You don't have to say anything, Edinburgh.
I choose to. You made my wildest dream come true, Captain.
Look, it wasn't just me. The crew set it up. And they all pitched in for the gloves, besides.
I couldn't ask for a better crew. But you led me to them. And my heart led me to you.
Just... spend a little bit of time with me in the bathhouse before the crew has to take it all down, okay?
Wouldn't dream of missing it. You'll have to take your gloves off, of course.
Then let's go turn them. Together.
Almost done with this book. Time to get another from Edinburgh soon...
*ALARM*
Where'd I put that bookmark...
@BATTLE
Good work in that battle, Edinburgh.
Aye, same to you, Captain. You getting back to some relaxation?

Fields.MenuText: I was going to finish my book.
Maybe try out the Turkish bathhouse with somebody special.
Haven't thought ahead that far.

Fields.DialogueText: I think Hemingway agrees with you, Captain! But I know a better place to take him in.
Tempting, isn't it? Ha!
Then come with me. I've a place in mind you've already guessed.
I think it'll be more than warm enough in there.
Easier to turn the pages, too.
